Description: Pottery flagon or jug in Red Slip ware of Roman date; wheel-made; baggy or depressed ovoid body on a broad ring base; tall cylindrical neck with a large, everted spool-shaped rim; two-ribbed, angular handle from shoulder to neck; buff clay with a lustrous red slip, surface calcinated in places.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Horatio Herbert Kitchener, Earl Kitchener of Khartoum
Curator's comments: See Bailey, Op. Ath. VI (1965), pp. 5-13 for details of the Hake-Kitchener excavations.
Acquisition name: Transferred from: Victoria and Albert Museum
